vulnerabilities.explanation: Classic XSS payload that injects a script tag executing alert immediately; high risk as many filters fail to block this simple vector.
Injects an image with invalid src that triggers the onerror event handler, executing arbitrary JavaScript; widely supported event.
Uses SVG tag’s onload event to execute JavaScript immediately upon SVG loading; SVG tags often bypass traditional HTML sanitizers.
Injects JavaScript on the body element’s load event, triggering execution as the page loads; highly effective in full HTML injection.
Input element auto-focused triggers alert via onfocus event; effective in forms or input fields with autofocusing.
CSS animation triggers JavaScript on animation start event, blending CSS and JS for execution.
Iframe tag loads JavaScript URL, executing alert; often blocked but very dangerous if allowed as it can run arbitrary JS.
Image error event with no operation, useful for controlling or evading filters.
Alert triggers when mouse enters page body; requires user interaction but can be unexpected.
Triggers alert when user inputs text, useful for interactive injection points where input events occur.
Object tag loads javascript URI, executing alert; less common but valid injection.
JavaScript triggered on drag start event; requires user to drag element.
Meta refresh tag redirects immediately to JS alert; often blocked but valid in some contexts.
Anchor tag with javascript URI in href executes alert on click; common vector when hrefs are not sanitized.
Anchor element triggers alert when focused (e.g., tabbed into); needs keyboard interaction.
Old IE-only behavior style; largely obsolete and ineffective in modern browsers.
Button with formaction set to javascript URI executes alert upon clicking; exploits form controls.
Alert triggers if image loading is aborted; rare but possible event vector.
MathML element with href attribute set to javascript URI, triggering alert; bypasses filters not checking MathML.
Triggers alert when mouse enters image area; requires user interaction but can be stealthy.
Image src with javascript URI; widely blocked by browsers but may work in some older versions.
Details tag ontoggle event fires alert when the element toggles open/close; often overlooked by filters.
CSS background image URL using javascript:void(0); no alert but tests JS in CSS.
SVG animation element triggers alert on animation start event; uncommon but effective in SVG contexts.
SVG description tag triggers alert on mouse hover; rare and interaction-dependent.
SVG set element triggers alert on load with timing; less reliable and less common vector.
CSS animation triggers alert on start; less common but valid vector combining CSS+JS.
Similar to above but tabindex=-1 removes from tab order; may be focused programmatically.
Injects script inside SVG tag; SVG content often less sanitized.
Disabled input with onfocus alert; typically non-focusable but tests edge cases.
Deprecated blink tag; no script execution, purely visual effect.
Payload breaks out of an HTML attribute or tag context to inject a script tag; very effective for attribute injection points.
Inject script inside MathML element; bypasses some filters.
Steals cookies by sending them to an attacker-controlled server; critical risk.
Video source error triggers alert via onerror event; exploits media elements for JavaScript execution.
Image error handler runs harmless JS logging to console; used for testing or evasion.
CSS injection changes appearance but does not execute JS; can still impact UX.
Deprecated marquee tag; no script execution but may disrupt layout.
Triggers alert when video starts playing automatically.
Old IE expression CSS injection that executes JS when style is evaluated.
Details element toggles alert when open/close state changes.
JavaScript URI with obfuscated alert using char codes to evade simple filters.
Iframe srcdoc with escaped image onerror triggers alert; less common and needs nested parsing.
Image input triggers alert on error, useful in form contexts.
Audio element error triggers alert; autoplay ensures it runs immediately.
ForeignObject allows injecting HTML/JS inside SVG, which may bypass filters.
Form with button that triggers JS on form submission.
Similar to high risk details payload, but here without open attribute, requiring toggle by user.
MathML mtext element triggers alert on mouse hover; requires interaction and is obscure.
Form submission runs JavaScript in action attribute, enabling alert when submitted; dangerous in forms.
Anchor href with base64 encoded JavaScript alert payload; obfuscation technique.
Triggers alert when input loses focus; requires user interaction.
Triggers alert when image loads successfully; less common but possible.
Triggers alert on mouse button press, earlier than click event.
Executes JS on scroll event; user interaction needed but stealthy.
Data URI iframe embedding base64 JS alert; less common but possible.
Triggers alert when user copies content; low risk as it requires interaction.
Triggers alert on text selection inside input; user interaction needed.
Executes JS on mouse wheel scroll; low risk due to interaction requirement.
Inject script inside details tag, requires user toggle.
Injects script inside SVG tag; SVG content often less sanitized.
Sets window.onerror to trigger alert on any script error, then throws an error to execute it; high risk due to immediate execution and filter bypass potential.
Iframe with srcdoc attribute executes embedded script immediately; high risk due to direct JS execution in unsanitized contexts.
Uses eval in onerror to execute alert; high risk as eval can run arbitrary code, bypassing some sanitizers.
Object tag with data URI executes embedded script; high risk in unsanitized contexts allowing data URIs.
Image input triggers alert on error; medium risk as it requires an invalid src but works in form contexts.

Triggers alert on pointer hover; medium risk as it requires user interaction but is stealthy.

Triggers alert when video is paused; medium risk due to user interaction requirement.

Triggers an alert by setting the onerror attribute to execute JavaScript when an error is thrown; bypasses some filters by inducing a script error, highly effective in attribute injection contexts.

Triggers JavaScript execution via the onbegin event of an SVG animateMotion element, which activates when a motion animation starts; requires SVG rendering and user interaction with the page, making it less immediate but effective in bypassing filters that don’t sanitize SVG animation events, especially in unsanitized input fields or attributes.
Direct JavaScript URI executes an alert when injected into unsanitized attributes like href or src; dangerous due to immediate execution in vulnerable contexts like URL parameters.
Uses vbscript URI to trigger message box; low risk due to limited browser support (IE only).

Data URI with an embedded script executes an alert when loaded in unsanitized contexts like href or iframe src; exploits poor sanitization of data URIs, critical for reflected XSS.

Executes an alert when a CSS animation completes; requires an animation style but can bypass filters not checking animation events, useful in styled elements.
Triggers an alert when the user presses a key on an element; effective in interactive input fields or editable elements, bypassing filters that don’t block keypress events.
